item.title: The Quiet Calculus of Probabilistic Commutativity
item.description:
Abstract

Eventual consistency dominates many internet-scale systems, but reasoning about concurrency under minimal coordination remains ad hoc. This post introduces “probabilistic commutativity” â€” a lightweight calculus for reasoning about whether concurrent operations, under reasonable stochastic assumptions about ordering and visibility delays, are likely to commute in practice. Probabilistic commutativity offers an intermediate lens between strict algebraic commutativity and empirical test-driven guarantees, enabling low-overhead coordination strategies and probabilistic correctness arguments for producing practically consistent distributed services.
